flow.descriptionCdata:
261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.00836016-82fc-4dbe-94e2-dc0d4a9297a0.prompt=Port\: 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.14aa2550-22cc-4dd2-bac9-88776f65be43.prompt=Enter a value for lockId 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.185618dc-fb13-4c26-84fd-712866373901.prompt=Protocol\: 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.29d83f2b-f4e7-4f5b-ada3-b07eccf5cd71.description=
Deletes a SiteScope monitor group

Inputs\:
hostname - The DNS name or IP Address of your SiteScope host.
port - The port to connect to your SiteScope host on.
protocol - The protocol to connect to your SiteScope host with (HTTP or HTTPS).  HTTPS is not configured by default during SiteScope install.
username - The username for the SiteScope host.
password - The password for the SiteScope user.
monitorPath - Path of monitor group to delete (eg. Monitors\MonitorGroup).  If seen in the UI, do not include the "SiteScope" root folder.

Responses\:
success - The monitor group was successfully deleted.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Return result of the monitor run
261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.2b9cdc57-b736-42bf-95ab-0ee4f3fa6b43.description=Attempts to acquire the specified lock, and sleeps until the lock is available. 
Inputs\:
   lockId - the id of the lock, maximum 255 characters.
   timeout - The maximum number of seconds this flow will run for.
  seconds - The number of seconds to sleep for between each attempt at acquiring the lock.

Responses\:
   success - if the lock has been successfully acquired.
   failure - if the lock could not be acquired.

Result\:
   Code - 0 if the operation succeeds, 1 otherwise.

Notes\:
1) The locks acquired by this operation are not reentrant. This means that 
   once a lock is acquired by a run, all subsequent attempts at acquiring 
   the same lock by the same run (or any other run) will fail.

2) Once a run terminates, all the locks that were acquired during its execution
   are automatically released.
261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.5009a816-0b43-4b25-a430-a3ef2f46ca41.prompt=Protocol\: 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.5c685bc5-94a2-49a6-a13f-7b321ea2723f.prompt=Host\: 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.677f2177-73ba-4aad-a066-44f206f1ee19.prompt=Enter a value for toMatch 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.728deabe-2e31-4368-8055-c3948d15430c.description=
Checks to see if a string matches a specific rule.

If the matchType is RegEx, input matchTo is the regular expression like \: ^-?\d+(([\.,]\d+)?)+$. Input toMatch is the actual string to check to see if it matches the matchTo expression.

Inputs\:
matchType - The type of match to perform.
toMatch - The string to check if matches another string.
matchTo - The string to match against. 
ignoreCase - Boolean value for whether or not to ignore case during match.

Responses\:
success - The String matched.
failure - The string did not match, or something went wrong.
261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.89c4c9f8-d331-420b-b7ed-0151e41674ec.description=
Deletes a SiteScope remote server from the list of available remote server configurations. 

Inputs\:
    hostname - The DNS name or IP address of your SiteScope host.
Examples\: myhost.mydomain, 10.10.10.10
    port - The port to connect to your SiteScope host on.
    protocol - The protocol to connect to your SiteScope host with. 
Valid values\: HTTP, HTTPS.
    username - The username for the SiteScope host.
    password - The password for the SiteScope user.
    name - The display name of the remote server to be removed. 
    platform - The underlying computer system of the remote server. 
Valid values\: Windows, UNIX. (case-insensitive) 
Default value\: Windows.

Results\:
    returnResult - This is the primary output. It contains a success message if the remote server was removed or an exception message if the operation failed. 

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully and the remote server was removed from the list of available servers.
    failure - Could not remove the remote server.

Notes\:
1. This operation is available starting with version 11.10 of SiteScope.
261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.8b8fb55c-4bc2-4ce4-81a6-8fdce25872ed.description=
Adds a flow variable into the local context (available to itself and child flows only)

Input Parameters\:
keyName - the name of the flow variable to use
myValue - the value to assign the flow variable

Responses\:
success - assigned the flow variable

Scriptlet Example\:
[$scriptletContext putGlobal\: $keyName, $myValue];
261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.9a293102-edec-45f1-aa20-518ff580a26b.prompt=Enter a value for lockId 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.9efa47d5-1c13-477c-8ad7-27c974538bf2.prompt=Host\: 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.c74b96ae-7742-4d9f-84a9-e7c4bc8aa424.prompt=Port\: 261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.d15b9a11-933d-4c30-b0f2-da3ebff6b63a.description=Releases a lock with an id given by the value of the lockId input. 
Inputs\:
   lockId - the id of the lock, maximum 255 characters.

Responses\:
   success - the only response returned.

Results\:
   there are no results.

Notes\:
1) The operation only releases locks acquired by the current run. 
   It cannot release another run's locks.

2) The operation succeeds whether or not there is a lock held 
   by the current run with the supplied id.
261d12d9-9a68-4048-828c-4af046abc7cf.description=
This flow undeploy sitescope monitor for created target VM on sitescope server.  It is assumed that CSA templates is deployed and valid monitor is created in sitescope server before this flow is executed.

Inputs\:
serverIPAddress	\: The IP address of the provisioned vm
osType		\: The operating system (WINDOWS or LINUX)
monitorHost		\: The DNS name or IP address of your SiteScope host.
monitorPort 		\: The port to connect to your SiteScope host on.
monitorProtocol	\: The protocol to connect to your SiteScope host with (HTTP or HTTPS).  HTTPS is not configured by default during SiteScope install.
monitorUser		\: The username for the SiteScope host.
moitorPassword 	\: The password for the SiteScope user.
monitorPath		\: The complete monitor path available in sitescope server to be deleted (e.g \: CSA Monitors\${reqOrgName}-${reqUserName}\${SVC_INSTANCE_ID})
   

Response\:
success		\: Server monitor deletion succeeded for the target VM in sitescope server
failure		\: Server monitor deletion failed for the target VM in sitescope server
flow.name: Undeploy Server Monitor
